intro: Eleocharis calva var. australis, commonly known as the slender spike-rush, is a flowering plant species native to parts of Australia and New Zealand. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and small, clustered spikelets that produce tiny flowers. It typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of water bodies. Eleocharis calva var. australis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
